Description: Rectangular wooden scribal palette; cartouche of Amenhotep III at top; name of Pamerihu inscribed in depression.
Curator's comments: Published: Glanville, S.R.K., JEA Vol.18, 1932, pp. 57-58, pl. VI, 3; VIII, 2.
On provenance see M.L. Bierbrier, 'Pamerihu Finds a Home', GM 179 (2000), 7-8, listing other objects fom Pamerihu's tomb at Saqqara (EA 8703 and 35029).
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-present, Glasgow, Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
